text: Carlos Andrés Alvarado Quesada (San José, January 14, 1980) is a Costa Rican writer, journalist, political scientist and politician. He was the President of Costa Rica from 2018 to 2022. He served as Minister of Labor and Social Security. On April 1, 2018 Alvarado won the presidential election by 61% after promising to support gay marriage. ==References== Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:20th-century journalists Category:Political scientists Category:Costa Rican writers Category:Presidents of Costa Rica Category:Current national leaders
title: Carlos Alvarado Quesada
